summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, revising the briefing schedule for motions in limine and setting the start time for voir dire on November 16, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, revising the briefing schedule and setting the start time for voir dire.

events.title: Conference on Motions in Limine
events.description: A conference was held regarding the defendant's first and seventh motions in limine.

events.title: Start of Voir Dire
events.description: The scheduled start of jury selection (voir dire) for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court order revises the briefing schedule for Ghislaine Maxwell's first and seventh motions in limine.
The government's submission on the motions is due November 12, 2021, and the defense submission is due November 15, 2021.
Voir dire (jury selection) for the trial is scheduled to begin at 8:30 a.m. on November 16, 2021.
The order is issued by United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
